problem.p: The system is the block, spring, Earth and the surface.
Interactions:

External: box and surface, wall and the fixed end of the spring. As a result of these interactions, there is a normal force on the box (no work on the box), friction and the force exerted by the wall on the fixed end of the spring that does no work because the displacement is zero.
Internal:
- spring and block
- Earth and block
These two interactions are conservative therefore are included as potential energies.
Model: Energy and work. We can evaluate the work done by friction.
Initial state is right before the block hits the spring with vo and the spring is at its natural length.
Final state is at the instant when the block is at rest and the spring is compressed a distance xf with respect to its equilibrium position.
Choose x=0 when the block first hits the spring and let xf denote the position where the block comes to rest.
The energy bar chart for the process, and the work-energy equations are shown below:

Note that the force is not constant (so we have to integrate the force over the displacement to determine the work done).
